abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. Zambia Enterprise Development Project's
            (EDP's) Multipurpose Credit Facility (MCF)
            component's excellent performance indicates several
            very important lessons regarding preparation and design of
            lines of credit. Firstly, it shows that lines of credit
            operations must be prepared after carrying out substantial
            economic sector work both in real and financial sectors.
            Secondly, it emphasizes that lines of credit operations
            should be in tune with overall macro economic policies and
            ongoing reform programs. Thirdly, it demonstrates that
            credit lines are most effective when they are fully
            intermediated by commercial banks. MCF also offers solutions
            to deal with risks associated with foreign exchange
            denominated lending by essentially dividing these risks in
            two parts. First, the foreign exchange rate risk was left
            entirely with the borrowers. Second, the foreign exchange
            availability risks (i.e. possible re-introduction of
            currency controls. etc.) was assumed by the apex by making
            it possible to pay in local currency at the prevailing
            exchange rate of the repayment date. EDP's Matching
            Grant Scheme (MGS) component clearly shows that such
            schemes, when designed for mainstream businesses, are very
            much dependent on the size of the existing corporate sector.
            EDP's technical assistance component demonstrates that
            necessary technical assistance must be included to support
            project's objectives and implementation. EDP
            demonstrates that modular project design with clear
            identification of operational responsibilities eases
            implementation. Modularity essentially localizes problems
            during implementation and prevents a contagion of problems
            across the entire project.
